Replies.Reply: I am a common woman. I was born in a common cottage in a common village. My life would likely be no different from yours, were it not for the most uncommon events that occurred during the winter of the Year of Our Lord Thirteen Hundred and Twenty-five. I learned many things that winter.
To this day, I am the only person that I know to be living who knows the whole truth about that horrible time. This is my tale.
I never saw him again.
Henri and I were married. He was a good man and a good father. I loved him very much. But I never loved him the same way that I loved Peter. That was the one secret in our marriage.
I only tell you now because he is dead. And if he knows now, I believe that he forgives me, for he must also know that I never loved him falsely.

This is my story, not that I expect you will believe it. In my own village, the events of that awful winter have already passed into legend. Parents tell their children to be good or else the Wolf will come and gobble them up.
They've already forgotten. A simple children's story is all that remains.
But sometimes, when the moon is full, my thoughts still turn to Peter. He promised me that I would never see him again. And I never have.
But I often wonder if I hear him.
Did you hear that?
The innkeeper told me --
Wait, wait! Be quiet!
Wait! We have to help him!
Honestly, Isabelle. Just kill it.
Do you realize how this makes me look? I'm older than her by more than a year. If anyone should be getting married in the spring, it's me.
Shut up.
Please. Just shut up and mind your own business.
I can't. It's the fifth commandment. Thou shalt not kill.
I'm going to take Father some water.
I can do it myself.
Mother thought you might be thirsty.
You should know better than that.
I think my sister's starting to suspect something.
I don't care. I wish she would tell him. I want everyone to know. Besides, my father likes you.
What's going on?
Was it the Wolf?
I know. You say that every month.
I'd better go.
Don't get used to this. I start my sewing lessons next week.
I'll manage somehow. Pride is a cardinal sin, by the way.
Yes, Mother.
I know.
You look happy.
Oh, no! Which one?
What's the matter, Rosemaria?
Yes, ma'am.
She works with the women.
I don't know how to yet.
Like a child.
What about?
Telling you what?
Henri Smith? Is this a joke?
Who told you this?
So Henri Smith is in the family's interest and Peter is not?
But what? He's poor? He's an orphan?
Why? Because they hadn't lived here since Noah built the ark?
Hello, Henri.
Yes. My parents are very pleased.
It's a very generous arrangement.
I'm not sure. We've never really talked that much.
What for?
Not until the spring festival.
All right. What would you like to talk about?
Well, I'm glad we had this conversation.
What happened?
Didn't you want to marry your sweetheart?
You've never wished you could have married that other boy?
I don't care what my parents want.
It does to me. Doesn't it matter to you?
You sound like my mother.
I don't believe you.
I don't believe you!
Yes, Father.
As if she would really tell you something like that.
Come on. We're going to be late.
What are you doing?
You can't go that way. You have to stay on the path.
People still die.
You were right. About Peter. I was being childish.
But I'm not going to marry Henri.
The family gains the same no matter which one of us marries him. And I don't love Henri.
She's right. It's not fair. I will gladly trade places with her.
I'm sorry... I...
I think I'd like that.
What is it?
Nobody. I just --
It was folded when they found her.
She was so unhappy.
Maybe she went into the woods on purpose. Maybe she wanted to die.
I'm sorry. I just need to talk to someone. Can I come in?
I hate the cold. Why can't we have lessons in the summer?
I heard your father wounded the beast. He was a brave man.
You told me you had a sweetheart before you were married. It was Henri's father, wasn't it?
Lucie was in love with Henri. She could have married him.
Couldn't she have?
But you gained the same no matter which one of us married him. So why did it have to be me?
No. You say it.
Am I? Do you even know?
Does he know?
I don't know what to do. She wants me to pretend like I don't know. How am I supposed to go on living in that house?
I'm going to the festival.
Someone has to look after him.
Please, don't do this --
Peter! Wait!
I just want to make sure you're all right.
You're bleeding.
You think I want to feel like this? You think I enjoy feeling like a fool every day because I can't stop loving you?
Why are you with Rosemaria? You hate Rosemaria.
You're a terrible liar.
There. You're heart is starting to beat faster. And the little black circles in the middle of your eyes still get bigger when I touch you.
You can tell me you don't love me, but I know what you're really feeling. I can feel it with my hand and see it with my eyes.
How could you think that?
That means less to me now than ever. We can leave here. We can go someplace where we'll both be strangers.
The only life I want is with you.
I know you are. I just don't care.
I don't want to wait.
It's not soon enough.
This feels like a dream. I'm afraid if I leave you I might wake up.
I've never seen it full before...
You have to stop it. He can't hear you and you are going to get us killed. Do you understand me?
Come on!
How do you know me? Who are you?
What big eyes you have...
Are you going to kill us?
Then what do you want?
I don't know who you are, but we are not the same. I would rather die than go with you.
Is Peter here?
What about Claude? Or my parents?
Would you look for them? Please?
It talked to us.
Do not speak of this to anyone.
Mother! Father!
Is she dead?
Peter... My mother's hurt. I can't leave. Not now.
I don't have any choice. It's not just my mother. Something else happened last night.
I can't tell you about it. I just have to stay.
I meant everything I said. This isn't what I wanted.
Has Claude come home?
He's run away before. He'll be all right.
As clearly as I do you now.
Roxanne will never speak of it.
I have to do what it wants.
I have communed with an unholy beast. What does that make me if not cursed?
But if it comes back for me and I don't go with it, then it will kill again. If I have the power to save even one life, aren't I compelled to do so?
But how could it? Unless it really does know me?
What about my family's debt?
But who is it?
What's wrong? What's happening?
It's not him! It can't be!
It isn't him. It can't be. He was with us when the Wolf attacked.
He was there! He carried Claude away! He saved his life!
Why wouldn't Father Solomon listen to me? Doesn't he care that Claude isn't guilty?
But the Wolf is free. And the moon will be full in two days.
I cannot leave.
What is unthinkable is that I should be responsible for the deaths of everyone that I love.
But what if it was you it wanted?
No. I do not deny it.
It spoke, just as a man speaks.
It told me... It promised to leave here and never return. But only if I leave with it.
I don't know! I swear I don't know!
That's impossible. Even Father Solomon doesn't have the first clue.
What was it like in the old days?
It's grown bold.
But who would want to kill Lucie?
My mother made me swear I would never speak of it.
Lucie went to the Wolf willingly.
She was in love with Henri.
What other explanation is there?
Has there been any word from my grandmother?
What have you done to him?!
I love you so much. Tell Mama and Grandmother that I love them.
Help...
Help me... Please... Help me...
HELP ME! PLEASE! WHY WON'T  SOMEBODY HELP ME?!
I can hear you.
I know. Will you tell her that I forgive her?
You don't have to say anything.
I think you'd better go now.
Get away from me!
Yes! Yes, please hurry!
Peter? Where is he --?
I don't think so...
My place will never be with you.
They're still good people.
The Wolf is a man. It told me.
Follow me.
We need to come inside. Quickly.
They're searching everywhere. We have to keep moving.
Can we go out your back window?
Henri, what are you doing?
He's right. It's a coward at heart. Look at it. Why doesn't it attack?
It's past noon.
Where's Father?
Did they catch the Wolf?
What about Grandmother?
I'm fine. You sent Henri to help me.
Those people back there. I know they mean well, but they're just people. I didn't expect anything from them. I expected something from you.
I'm going to see my Grandmother.
Grandmother? Are you awake?
Mother sent some food. There are cakes and a pot of butter --
Are you sure? You sound so weak.
I came here to take care of you.
You always say that.
I've been worried about you. When you didn't come back yesterday, I was afraid...
You were wrong about Henri.
Yes. He saved my life.
I feel hot all of a sudden.
What is this...?
I don't think I want to.
What is this? Where's Grandmother?
You're not the Wolf. You can't be...
Oh, dear God... You killed Lucie?
Yes, she was. In every way that matters, she was.
Did Grandmother know?
Yes, Father.
There must indeed be a God. For you are surely the Devil...
Father...?
You gave me two choices.
But I have thought of a third.
People should know what he was.
Then I'll run away. I was ready to run away last night.
Why didn't you come for me?
No, you're not. You could never be like him.
Yes, you can. We can still be together. My father lived here.
I don't want him ever found.
No. We'll put the rocks inside him.
Cut him open. I will sew the rocks inside him.
Wait.
These belonged to my grandmother.
I can live with it.
Where will you go?
I know.
No, it isn't. You'll be in my dreams until the day I die.
Yes, he is.
All right. Don't be long.
You mind your grandmother, understand? You're her student now, the same as the other girls.
My last baby has grown up.
It's all been arranged. Your marriage to Henri will settle our debt to his father.
We know that you and Peter have become friends. But you have adult responsibilities now. That means putting your family's interests ahead of your own.
He's not one of us. His parents were outsiders.
You mind your tongue.
We knew Isabelle was going to be stubborn. It wouldn't be like her to simply do as she's told. She's too much like her grandmother.
She's a good girl, but she's still a child. Talk to her. You're her father. She'll listen to you.
You know, I had a sweetheart when I was your age, too.
Nothing happened. My parents arranged for me to marry your father and that was the end of that.
Of course, I did. But there's more to marriage than being in love. Love doesn't always last and it certainly doesn't fill your children's bellies in the winter.
Not even once.
You'll do as you're told. It's all been arranged.
Who gave you permission to wear that?
Your Grandmother made that for Lucie. Take it off.
Someone must have folded them.
What are you saying?
Lucie's soul is at peace with God.
We arranged for you to marry him.
I think you know the answer to that question.
Lucie was Henri's half-sister.
Yes. I was already pregnant when your father and I married.
No. And he must never know.
Isabelle!
Promise me you won't tell him.
All right then.
I know. I didn't want to wake you.
He'll be home soon. They have no reason to hold him any longer.
No. They lost it in the forest.
Roxanne came by. She said your grandmother has fallen ill. I was hoping you could look in on her.
Hey, there! Let one of these young lads get that for you.
I don't know.
The caves. It's in the caves.
She is mistaken. I did no such thing.
That was very thoughtful of her.
Peter is a fine young man.
This was your idea. Now I have both of them hating me.
That she is. What about Lucie?
This doesn't concern you, Isabelle.
A line has been crossed. The beast must be destroyed!
She was taken. She must have been!
Even if Father Solomon agrees to help us, it will take weeks for him to get here. That means another full moon. Maybe two.
My father died trying to kill the Wolf. For forty years, we have lived in fear of it. But no more.
Get that torch out.
You're a good girl.
But he did scream. We all heard him.
ever heard anything more unlikely in your lives?

You come here and tell us that this boy's father died for nothing. You accuse us and call us fools. Well, I believe what I can see with my own eyes. That wolf is dead. And I know it's dead because I was with the brave men who killed it.
No, thank God.
Isabelle! Get away from there!
You should have condemned him today. At least it would have been quick.
Are you ready for me to take you home?
Will you want a ride into town tomorrow? To say goodbye to her?
I don't know. I went to pick her up this morning and she was gone.
Isabelle...
I love you, my angel. You don't know how much.
Bastards!
I'm afraid I ate most of her.
You ate the rest.
I didn't want to kill her. But she finally realized what I was.
The hardest thing to hide has always been the smell. The werewolf musk is strong, especially close to the full moon.
Henri smelled it the night he saw me. And he recognized the smell later.
He thought it was your Grandmother. He didn't know he was smelling me. But she did.
Once she realized what it was, of course, she knew the truth. She tried to sneak a message to Father Auguste last night.
Luckily, she'd taught me how to read.
Look into my eyes. The one part of me I can never change.
I did more than that to her.
I only wish your mother could have known what I did to her. The girl she passed off as my daughter.
I was made a cuckold by your mother. But I paid her back.
I paid her lover back, too.
Lucie was the joy of my life. But she wasn't mine.
No. Not in every way that matters. My father sired me. I am a werewolf because it was in his blood. Because I was his.
No. And neither does your mother.
I put an herb in the beer to make you sleep whenever the moon was full. One of your Grandmother's old remedies.
That's how my father got away with it. Your grandmother never learned the truth. Until last night.
I began to turn when I was fourteen. My father and I ran together. We hunted freely.
Our only mistake was that we gorged ourselves too often on the fat flesh of the villagers.
They killed my father.
The fools thought my father had been thrown in the pit by the Wolf. They never suspected that he was the Wolf.
I tried to live as my father did, but I came to realize that I did not belong here. The Wolf was my true self. It wasn't something to be hidden. It was a gift. I had to leave here and never return.
But I did not want to go alone.
Instead, God gave me daughters.
But female werewolves are not born. They are made. And I chose my eldest.
When I finally decided to leave, I told Lucie the truth. And I gave her a choice. She could come with me. Or I would take you instead.
This doesn't concern you, Isabelle.
She agreed to come with me. She did it to protect you.
We arranged to meet on the night of the next full moon.
She was not a werewolf yet. I had to turn her.
First, she had to eat human flesh.
The bite should have changed her.
Afterwards, I thought about killing myself. The only thing that kept me alive was you.
You were so beautiful. So kind.
Do you see now? This is your heritage. This is what you are.
like my father and I once did.
I will give you a choice. Come with me now. Or refuse me and let your friends suffer in your place.
Yes, my dear?
I'm taking a break.
I was afraid you weren't coming.
Do you think she'll tell your father?
Of course he does. Right up until the point where he figures out what I'm doing with his daughter.
You haven't heard?
Three men. They found them this morning just off the Center Road.
Could it have been anything else?
We should have killed that monster a long time ago.
Same time tomorrow?
You really think you can go all day without seeing me?
I can think of worse sins I could be committing.
I need to talk to you.
When were you planning on telling me?
That you're engaged to be married to Henri Smith.
Look at me. Just look at me and tell me you didn't know.
Your father.
We need to talk.
You have to go through with it.
That doesn't matter.
It's not our decision to make.
Then maybe you should start listening to your mother.
It's over. They had to find out eventually. Don't turn this into something that it's not. We had our fun, but that's all it ever was.
Go home, Isabelle. Go home and grow up.
Are you all right?
Are you joking? These fools are as likely to kill each other as they are anything else.
Take it easy, friend.
Why? So you can hit me, too?
Why can't you just leave me alone?
So what? What's the matter with you? What do I have to do to make you stop caring about me?
I don't have to like her to get what I want from her.
I thought being with Rosemaria would be the one thing you would never be able to forgive. I wanted you to hate me.
Isabelle, you are the best thing that could ever happen to me. And I am the worst thing that could ever happen to you.
I wasn't born here. You and I both know what that means. I will always be a stranger to these people. Your parents will never let us be together.
a family. With Henri you have a future. I'm not going to let you ruin that over me.
Isabelle... I'm wrong for you.
But not like this.
I want to marry you.
I can pack the cart tonight and we can leave in the morning.
Is that too soon?
You'd better get back before someone misses you.
What's wrong?
I was up all night worrying about you. Thank God you're safe.
I thought you didn't want to wait.
Of course not. You'd better go home and see to your mother.
I need your help.
Thank God you're all right.
What did he tell you?
I just need to talk to you.
Hello?
We can't tell anyone. If they don't believe you, they'll hang you for this. And if they do believe you, they'll hang you for being the daughter of the Wolf.
I was bitten at the festival. I spent last night in the woods because I was afraid of what might happen...
I changed. I'm like him now.
I can't stay here.
Your father and your grandfather killed people. They couldn't help themselves. If I stay here, I won't be able to control myself.
I have to be alone.
We could take him to the river.
We'll weight him with rocks.
They're silver.
Death was too good for him.
I don't know. I need to understand what I've become.
I'm not coming back. I don't want you to wait for me. This is the last time you'll ever see me.
You know, Henri is a good man.
A break? Does that mean you're going to start working?
Half full! Half full!
Full moon! Full moon! Full moon!
Full moon! Full moon! Full moon!
You're only encouraging him.
I thought your mother would be here. They used to be quite close.
If he's not the werewolf, then why was he hiding? What's he afraid of?
In broad daylight with my own eyes. Everyone here has seen it.
Yes, Your Eminence. I saw it for the Devil's work, but they laughed at me and paid him money.
She's his sister! She'll say anything!
The first victim was her sister.
Not so pretty now, is she?
Aren't you excited?
I'm just trying to look on the bright side.
I don't know.
Well... you haven't told us what you're making.
What's wrong with Lucie?
Rosemaria...?
You can't just kill it. It's not an ordinary wolf. It's a devil-
Watching what?
A festival? I've never been to one!
It's strange, isn't it? You think because things have been a certain way your whole life that they'll always be the same. Then overnight everything just changes.
I'm sorry...
Claude!
Where's Claude? Where is he?!
Claude! Claude!
Have you seen my brother? Please!
Claude! Claude!!
Claude! Where are you?!
Isabelle...?
You talked to it.
No. It only growled.
You heard it talk to you?
No. Nobody has seen him.
Claude!!
I can! It's true! I saw him!
How can you just sit there and listen to this?
Don't you touch me again. Ever.
I would like to bargain for the release of my brother.
What? That's not possible!
I have more than money to offer you.
Wait! I have something else! I know the name of a witch!
Spare my brother and I will tell you her name.
We were friends.
All my life.
Yes, Your Eminence. On the night of the last full moon, she talked to the werewolf. And later she told me that it also talked to her.
I'm here for my brother.
Are you sure you don't want us to bring you something?
Then shut up so they don't find her.
You'll never make it. You can hide here until morning.
You might make it to the church.
Wait! I have an idea.
I can if you can.
It's too early to be excited.
Did you hear about her and the Darley brothers?
Both! On the same night!
To become seamstresses. To learn how to sew and mend clothes.
But it's not safe. My brother says the bridge is rotten.
If you get lost, nobody will come looking for you. Not tonight.
I wish someone would just kill that stupid wolf.
I heard there's going to be a festival on the night of the next full moon. To celebrate.
My father says he hasn't seen one since he was a boy.
She acts more like a mother to him than a sister.
I know. But who looks after her?
Peter? I don't think so.
I haven't seen any of them.
Well. I suppose this is all of us.
They've caught the werewolf!
He's been hiding in a hayloft.
All right.
Are you all right?
You sound awful. Would you like us to make you something?
Where's Peter?
Isabelle? Can you hear me?
Roxanne wanted you to know how sorry she is. She only said those things to save her brother.
Of course.
I wanted to say... I don't know what to say.
I want to.
I want you to know that you may have fooled Roxanne, but you don't fool me. Not anymore. You were always too good. Too pretty.
Yes. It won't be long now.
Well, stop it before somebody hurts you.
Why does your grandmother have to live so far away?
Why?
Isabelle stops short and gives Rosemaria a sharp look.
Really? So she's just had a crush on him since she was ten?
She didn't. She told my sister.
Did you honestly not know?
What does it look like?
This way is faster.
I don't care. It's bad enough working all day in that smelly cottage. It's not reasonable for them to expect us to walk that far every day on top of that.
Who cares what it is? It's only one night a month. You stay inside, lock up the animals, and you don't go into the forest.
Yes, but nobody we know.
No. You can't.
Well, stop dawdling. Come on, come on.
Your mother has warned you not to expect any special treatment from me?
Well, then your mother doesn't know me very well, does she?
There. This is going to be my foundation. Everything I do now will build off of this.
Roxanne, is this a good foundation?
Why not?
There's something else I haven't told you. I haven't told you why I'm making it. Before you begin any task, you must first always ask yourself why.
Because understanding why you are doing something is the key to doing it successfully. So, before we begin today, let's be certain that we have a good foundation.
That's what you are doing. But why are you doing it?
Isabelle, your sister studied with me last winter. What does she do now?
Why don't you work with them?
And how does that make you feel?

You will be coming here every day for the next three months. During that time, I will teach you everything you need to know to be productive members of our community. But there is something far more important that will also be happening here.
You will be proving your worth and learning your place in the world.
Everyone finish what you're working on. Your parents will be worried if you're not home before it starts to get dark.
My goodness. I had no idea our young people were so woefully uneducated these days.

Our village was not always like this. When I was young, this was a very special place. Traders and merchants came here from lands I'd never heard of selling things I had never seen. King Philip the Bold even visited here once. But that, of course, was before the Wolf came.

Your parents fear the Wolf because they remember when it did kill people from the village. Break down doors in the middle of the night and snatch children right out of their beds. Rumors began to spread that we were cursed.

After that, people here didn't have much stomach to go hunting for it anymore. But something had changed. The Wolf stopped killing in the village. Even our livestock were usually safe as long as they were brought inside.
Everyone knows what should be done. But it's not always easy to do what you know is right.
What on earth --?
It's my little secret. A pinch will help you rest. A little more and you'll sleep through the end of the world.
Nothing.
I know something.
I found this. I believe it must belong to her attacker.
No, it isn't. It's human.
Yet she was holding a man's hair in her hand when she died.
That the man and the Wolf may be one and the same.
Not someone. You're talking about Father Solomon.
I suppose that would be easier.
I've found that there's no burden that doesn't at least seem a little lighter on a full stomach.
You have a right to be angry with her. But try not to hate her.
It talked to you. And you understood it?
Word of this cannot be allowed to spread. Do you understand me?
I don't know. But I won't allow you to go with this devil and live as its concubine.
This is why it chose you. You're a good girl with a gentle heart.
Salus populi suprema est lex.
The good of the people is the chief law.
And write. I was studying to be a nun when I met my husband.
He was a priest.
You know the boy is innocent.
A wolf hunting sheep picks off the weakest ones first.
This is just the beginning.
He'd rather let an innocent boy die than risk letting the Wolf go free.
We both know it will be coming for you. You must leave here tomorrow and never return.
You have no choice. The alternative is unthinkable.
The Wolf's sins are on its own twice-damned soul, not yours.
Father Solomon. Extorting his confession.
What's the matter with you? You know her. You all know her.
She could have run away. She could saved herself, but she stayed here because she cares more about you than she does herself.
I'm not going to let these worthless shits sacrifice you to save themselves. We have to find the real werewolf before tomorrow night.
Father Solomon doesn't know the things that I know.
I am the oldest person in this village who was here when the Wolf first came. I remember the old days. And what is happening now is much worse.
The Wolf never used to attack in the open like it did at the festival. It's a coward at heart.
Or perhaps it made a mistake.
You're at the center of this. At least two of the victims can be tied to you. What if it had to kill so many at the festival to hide the fact that the first two killings weren't random?
Your parents said that the Wolf broke into the house and took Lucie. We both know that's not true. What really happened?
Why would you think such a thing?
She took her own life over a boy?
Hello, Henri.
You spoke up very loudly in Isabelle's defense today. That was very brave.
You're under no obligation to stand in her defense. You broke off your engagement to her.
As her sister would have done anything for you.
Lucie was in love with you. But you knew that, didn't you?
She kept it secret from almost everyone. Even Isabelle didn't know. Did you tell anyone?
Not even your father?
So he knew your secrets, did he?
You were the only one who could have lured Lucie out on the Wolf's night. And none of the men who went hunting for the Wolf remember seeing you after the sun set on the night your father died.
Because I want you to confess.
Smell what? What are you talking about?
You accuse me and I'll bring you down with me. All they can do is take my life. You have more to lose.
Then I'll have to prove it.
Stop the cart.
Prudence, come with me. I have some blankets I want you to mend for Father Auguste.
You take these blankets to Father Auguste the moment you're finished. Understand?
Yes. First thing in the morning.
Show yourself! Coward!
Hello, Isabelle.
So I suppose you've heard.
And you? Are you pleased?
Do you have any other feelings about it? About me?
I know. That's why I asked you to walk with me. I wanted to talk.
Well... because we're going to be husband and wife soon.
I'm not really sure. I brought you this.
I'm here for you, too.
He's right. The beast broke the peace, not us.
I will help you kill it.
I'm not doing it for her.
You're not coming with us?
Did you hear what it did to him?
